page.description: Returns the name of the control that has focus.
page.original:
&ltOBJECT>.ACTIVE() Syntax Control_Name as C = &ltOBJECT>.ACTIVE( [ Name_Flag as L ] ) ArgumentDescription Name_FlagOptional. Default = .F. (FALSE)
.F. = Returns control name.
.T. = Returns fully qualified control name.
Description The &ltOBJECT>.ACTIVE() method applies to:
Alpha Anywhere (for &ltOBJECT> use the keyword "A5")
Browses (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltBROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltFORM> pointer or the name of the form) The &ltOBJECT>.ACTIVE() method returns the name of the control with focus. If the .T. flag is specified, then a fully qualified name is returned. E.g. : sales.active(.T.) Limitations Desktop applications only. Example This script returns the name of the control on the Sales form that has focus. name = :Sales.Active()
See Also Form Functions and Methods, Browse Functions and Methods
